Homework 3, Problem 2

Comments: In general, we saw that the number of variables in the best regression model was greater than in the initial randomly sampled model. The AIC was on average in the 80s to 90s, with a low of 72 and high of 128. We see that there is a lot of chance involved, where the new model which was randomly selected would either have little effect on the AIC or could drastically reduce it, in which case the regression model would be very good. In all, we saw significant improvements in the AIC from the initial model to the best one.


Some results from the 10 trials, each run with 25 iterations:
